verbs.description: unlimb (third-person singular simple present unlimbs, present participle unlimbing, simple past and past participle unlimbed)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To remove a limb or limbs from.
examples: […]  at intervals during the passage, he was a raving lunatic; and, though unlimbed of a leg, yet such vital strength yet lurked in his Egyptian chest, and was moreover intensified by his delirium  […]
